author: soubir
title: Simply AI with Trust
description: AI is hard to consume for non-experts, no formal way to trust the quality, and no formal way to encode and get paid for micro-contributions.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a lofty goal however there is little in the way of a detailed plan on how to get there. It is asking for nearly the entirety of the challenge for what, I am not sure is even a tractable problem.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is not detailed budget breakdown of how they will achieve this plan. What is 300k for engineering to be spent on? What is the community manager doing for $100k?
Unfortunately this is an idea, not a plan. Thus it cannot be given a high probability of successful implementation. No evidence of experience is provided.
f6_assessments.q2: There is not detailed plan of what will be delivered so progress for that delivery cannot be audited. Alpha release/beta release/global release is not a delivery plan. What will be in those. What are the front end/back end steps. They have set user acquisition numbers by quarter which can be used for success measurement. However given there is no marketing plan these numbers can't be assumed realistic.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal wants to create an AI quality service utilising NFTs as labels, combined with a search engine for AI-solutions. This project could lower the current existing treshold for incorporating AI-services in modern companies and make these services more generally accessible. As an app-consumer, such as most people today, I have to admit that most AI-applications I come into contact with are almost exclusively through external companies employing these services in their apps. So the potential impact of making these solutions more widely available would most certainly be significant.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer's experience is quite abstract. So it isn't clear who would develop the Plutus-code in order to create the cNFTs' smart contracts. Nonetheless, the website and proposal layout indicate a high level of professionalism, which assures confidence that these steps would be taken shortly after potential funding. It is mentioned that all code concerning this project is to 'be open-sourced at an appropriate time', yet there is no specification as to when that time would occur. The requested funding for this proposal is 480K USD, which is nearly the entire fund for this challenge. That could strongly decrease chances of getting funded, unless the proposal manages to get the most votes out of all this challenge's proposals.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal holds virtually everything it needs in terms of auditability. There are clearly set KPI, a roadmap and the budget is broken down. The website offers a lot of additional information. I am kind of missing some team details, though. Is the current team just one person with several functions or are the functions mentioned on the website anonymous? So clarifying that could improve the proposal, as well as providing some outline as to why there is 100k USD reseved for a community advisor.

f6_assessments.q0: Building a search engine to provide a place where one is able to find the AI service he needs is something we need today. The amount of small apps using AI to generate content of context is large and spread all over the web. This brings both worlds into one place. PRoviding the AI build on SN and using ADA blockchain to enable the use cases for the AI apps.
f6_assessments.q1: Concerning feasibility, we are lacking some information on this proposal. Starting with the team, we get a brief introduction on the team but no details are presented. How many team members are there? Do you still need to hire members? We get little information on the team which makes it hard for us to assess if the team is qualified for the job. Another big concern is the budget for this proposal. It's 480k USD which is practically the entire fund for this challenge. This gives me very little confirmation that this proposal will get funded. It would've been better to split up this proposal for a better chance. The budget breakdown is rudimental and needs more details, how are you justifying 300K for engineering? Give exact numbers of the number of people in this how long to they need?
f6_assessments.q2: For auditability, the proposal has as good as everything needed. We have a clear roadmap, budget breakdown, KPIs which are in relation to the project. But as stated above we need details on the team. The budget could use more details as well. Each aspect of the budget breakdown needs more clarification as to why so much is needed.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about enabling auto-curated search, personalization, and publishing of micro AI apps as NFTs with verifiable community testing results on-chain. This is a great idea. The problem is clearly defined, suitable to the given challenge, and the proposed solution is clearly described [with a specific roadmap, budget distribution, and KPIs,...]. As a result, it addresses this challenge and shows the potential impact on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole. Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 4.
f6_assessments.q1: Team profile is briefly provided, it is understandable, shows suitable skill, and experiences for implementation, but without reference/proof for verifying. However, the plan was well-prepared, with a clear structure of the budget, specific roadmap, and KPIs (user acquisition). However, the budget explanation [why "Cloud costs (including GPUs)" cost "60k USD" ?, for example] and risk are not provided. Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2:
This proposal provided a lot of information that can be verified. However, for better understanding, (1) the budget distribution should be explained more in detail (why "Cloud costs (including GPUs)" cost "60k USD" ?, for example). (2) Risk/challenge analysis should be added
Based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 3

f6_assessments.q0:
Developing ways to make it easier to interact with and consume AI services could have a massive value to end consumers. The proposer details a system that curates and aggregates these services into a way that users can search, personalize and use for their own specific needs.

There is similarity with this proposal and what the SingularityNET offers as a service. That is a marketplace of AI services. The proposer has not delved into what this proposal is trying to achieve in comparison to SingularityNET. What is similar and what is very different? This comparison is needed to fully understand the impact of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
The only team information provided is as follows - 'Team with serial entrepreneurs, working at the intersection of AI delivery (SaaS), federated learning, K8s, security and data governance.'

The budget requested is very high at $480,000 and nearly captures the entire challenge budget.

The website link provided does not provide effective background information on the team but does provide some evidence of working in the AI market from viewing their services link - https://www.zero2ai.in/

Overall this proposal does not provide sufficient background information on the team and execution ability that is paired with a high budget request value. Due to this the proposal is of high risk to the community and would need far more evidence to support a better rating.
f6_assessments.q2: Clarity for the proposal is acceptable as the purpose and reasoning behind what will be implemented is given. A basic roadmap of milestones per quarter is provided. In terms of success objectives and KPIs only the number of users is provided. This makes it difficult to gage whether the proposal team has a strong sense of what metrics and factors will help show whether this proposal is impactful upon completion. The proposal also does not provide any implementation examples or statements about the proposal being open source or not which further make this proposal difficult to audit. Considering the budget requested the auditing information provided is not to an acceptable standard.

solution: Enable auto-curated search, personalization and publishing of micro AI apps as NFTs with verifiable community testing results on-chain.
experience: Team with serial entrepreneurs, working at the intersection of AI delivery (SaaS), federated learning, K8s, security and data governance.
